gcci.text: At $3.16 per hour for H100 instances, compute providers are facing margin compression while customers delay GPU capex purchases, creating a supply-demand imbalance that may force memory suppliers to cut prices 15-20% to restore procurement momentum.

gtpi.text: With input pricing at $1.25 per million tokens, the API market is entering a consolidation phase where smaller providers must either differentiate through specialized models or exit, as this price point represents the threshold where profit margins become sustainable only at scale.

gagl.text: The 120 TWh annual AI workload translates to approximately 36 million tons of CO2 equivalent annually, making grid decarbonization critical as data centers approach 3-4% of total electricity consumption in major markets.

aipi.text: While infrastructure costs remain elevated and power consumption escalates, the sector's trajectory suggests sustainable growth through efficiency gains rather than pure scaling, with enterprise adoption accelerating despite capital intensity concerns.
